title: In the silence
author: In the silence
content: A significant history of cryptography that was posted by cygan caught my attention.like the mc Donalds story.Although Ray Kroc, the originator, invented the renowned fast food, McDonalds is the original creator.This further persuades me that Bitcoin was not invented by a single person, making it decentralized.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: This looks like a plain semantics issue. Therefore, petty. Therefore, a non-issue. I don't think Satoshi claimed that he/she/they made everything from scratch. He/she/they actually acknowledged people and their works that led to the creation of Bitcoin. He/she/they created Bitcoin out of materials and resources that were already there. And Satoshi didn't miss pointing that out. It's probably the very reason why Satoshi used we instead of I in the whitepaper. QuoteThis further persuades me that Bitcoin was not invented by a single person, making it decentralized.Is this how decentralization is to be understood? I don't think so. I guess decentralization is not about whether a system is invented by a single person or not. It is immaterial whether Bitcoin is created by a single man or woman or a pair or a group. What is important is that the blockchain is not under the control of a single person or a handful of individuals. Ripple was also not founded by a single person. That fact doesn't make Ripple decentralized.

comments.body: The Bitcoin Origins - Explore Bitcoin History and SecretsBitcoin Wiki: https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Category:History161 History of Bitcoin 2007-2014Bitcoin has long history from cryptography innovation to very last discussion in Cypherpunks group before the launch by Satoshi Nakamoto.Whoever is Satoshi Nakamoto, a great work was done in coding and in the launch of Bitcoin network.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: In the silence on July 24, 2022, 02:05:51 AMlike the mc Donalds story.Although Ray Kroc, the originator, invented the renowned fast food, McDonalds is the original creator.It is nothing like that. Kroc stole McDonald's idea and franchised it without really changing anything about it.Satoshi invented a new payment system by using existing technologies and experience from other failed projects. Saying these two are the same is like saying the inventor of the first car stole the idea from the inventor of the wheel!QuoteThis further persuades me that Bitcoin was not invented by a single person, making it decentralized.Number of people who participated in this invention before release is not what makes it decentralized. Otherwise centralized shitcoins with multiple developers would also be decentralized.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on July 24, 2022, 03:53:56 AMSatoshi invented a new payment system by using existing technologies and experience from other failed projects. Saying these two are the same is like saying the inventor of the first car stole the idea from the inventor of the wheel!Precisely.There was no technology quite like bitcoin before it was created, neither has there been any like it, after it was launched.Previous innovative steps are all available for the present generation to utilize and create something unique from; There is no guarantee that their inventions would be good or accepted, but that is how advancements happen and they are unique. Bitcoin has been one of the biggest advancements in the payment system of the past decade or two.

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: Evolution is something that gets derived from existing things. So it's quite normal to say that Satoshi would have used existing technologies to create bitcoin.Even today, websites are being built on existing technologies and we all still use them at our convenience.It's the effort of putting in the extensive research and hard work to build a finished product out of the raw material.Satoshi has pretty much done the same thing to create bitcoin.
